answers.answer: Hi and welcome! I'm pretty sure that many will agree with you and wish they had never gotten on methadone. However, that's water under the bridge and what's most important is that you're ready to get off. I, personally, don't have any experience with methadone but there are tons on here that do and will be able to give you great advice! I have no clue about your methadone / diabetes question and I hope someone on here does.What are your plans for getting off the methadone? Are you taking vitamins / supplements? Keep us posted on your plans and how you're doing!

question: Try this again was at 140 down to 20 and starting to have a hard time. I sometimes think it was a bad idea going on methadone. Now at the clinic 4 of us have gotten diabetes. All have been on it for over 2 years and now this anyone else heard of this problem. Please help
title: withdrawal
